intro: Pristidia, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant blooms. Pristidia thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
